intro: Marrubium hirsutum, commonly known as hairy horehound, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Marrubium hirsutum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
